bibl.title: Dispatch from L. de R. du Verge to J.C. Bancroft Davis
Despatches from United States consuls in St. Paul de Loanda, 1854-1893

revisionDesc.change: Creation of individual xml files, review, and addition encoding

div1.note: Will regnze as a change in his No 5 Aug 31 Received June 29
div1.p: United States Consulate St Paul de Loanda S.W.C. Africa
L de R. de Verge To Dept of State Washington D.C.
Subject Request for thanks Forms, Flags, Boat, Flag staff ga
Encloses. Statement of the conditions in which the Consular archives ga are.
United States Consulate St Paul de Loanda June 29th 1882.
The Hon. J.C. Bancroft Davis Asst. Secretary of State Washington D.C.

Sir I have the honor most respectfully to request that the U.C. Govt. may Furnish this consulate with a boat Oars and sail. My seasons for asking Such are: that a boat here is the most Essential piece of furniture this consulate Could have, as to travel by land to the Places under this jurisdiction, in a Hammock cast too much, and being A seafearing man; I will be able to manage a boat to any pomt. of my consular supervision with more speed and less expenses, when each is required for the benefits of Americans and the goal I have the honor to represent here.
I have the honor to be Sir Your obedient servant L. de R. du Verge U.S. Consul
